subject: Politics
title: Why States Exist
description: A quick, practical guide to Why States Exist.

hook.text: Before states, humans lived in small bands. Agriculture created surplus â€” and reasons to fight.

buildup.text: Farming produced wealth that needed defending. Armies, taxes, and bureaucracies followed.

discovery.text: Charles Tilly argued states grew from war. Military competition forced societies to centralize.

twist.text: Many states weren't built by consent. They were forged by conquest and held by force.

climax.text: Today nearly every human lives within a state. Stateless existence is almost impossible.

punchline.text: States exist because organized power beats scattered freedom.

quiz.question: What did Charles Tilly argue about state formation?
options: War and military competition forced societies to centralize into states
States formed peacefully through voluntary agreements
Religion was the main driver of state creation
